nodes.description: 周六发生卡车炸弹袭击，与油罐车相撞，造成街道毁灭性破坏
nodes.support_text: Arriving at the scene of Saturday’s explosion, what he remembered as a bustling intersection crowded with street hawkers, vegetable sellers, and hotel guests had been transformed into a post-apocalyptic scene: the carbonised bodies of those killed in the explosion were strewn across the street, the Safari Hotel was rubble, and heat from the fire raging in the explosion’s aftermath could be felt 100 metres from the scene.

nodes.description: 第一次爆炸后出现火势失控和100米外可感高温的灾后场景

nodes.description: 30分钟后300米外发生第二次汽车炸弹爆炸
nodes.support_text: Roughly 30 minutes later, another car bomb exploded less than 300 metres from the site of the first blast, sending more victims to the six hospitals nearby that were already jammed with casualties.

nodes.support_text: According to the Somali government. The number of fatalities will probably increase as more bodies are found in the debris.

nodes.support_text: Since Mohamed Abdullahi Mohamed (known as “Farmaajo”) took office as president in February, national security has been his government’s priority.

nodes.description: 2023年8月美军与索马里军联合行动误杀10名平民
nodes.support_text: In August a joint raid by Somali and American soldiers led to the deaths of ten civilians in Bariire.

nodes.support_text: Only a week before the attack, the presidents of Somalia’s regional states refused to attend a constitutional convention with the federal government in Mogadishu, opting instead to have a meeting of regional presidents in Kismayo.
